sentences.english: The dog was sniffing (at) the lamp-post.
sentences.chinese: 那條狗在燈柱旁嗅來嗅去。

sentences.english: I nearly ran into a lamppost.
sentences.chinese: 我差點把車撞到路燈柱上。

sentences.english: Vingo charged into a lamppost and hurt his arm.
sentences.chinese: 文戈撞上了路燈柱，手臂受了傷。

sentences.english: Maybe that can help you approach the data lamppost with a bit more sobriety.
sentences.chinese: 也許這可以幫助你找到能令你清醒一點的數據燈柱。

sentences.english: Perhaps we'll see more padded lightposts in the future.
sentences.chinese: 或許我們在未來能看到更多的塑料襯墊燈柱吧。

sentences.english: The car ran into a lamp-post.
The lorry hit the lamp-post with a crash .
sentences.chinese: 卡車的一聲撞到路燈柱上了。

sentences.english: And then on one side a seven-branched lampstand or menorah.
sentences.chinese: 在一邊是一個有七條分支的燈柱或是燭臺。

sentences.english: the moths are flying around the light poles.

sentences.chinese: 他們正在用柏油塗料塗抹路燈柱。

sentences.english: In about ten minutes she reached it and found it was a lamp-post.
sentences.chinese: 大約走了十分鐘，她就到了那裏，原來這是一根燈柱。

sentences.english: The invention belongs to the technical field of an illuminator lamp post made by metal.
sentences.chinese: 本發明屬於用金屬製的照明用燈柱的技術領域。

sentences.english: The trees, flower-beds and lamp posts are symmetrically placed.
sentences.chinese: 和燈柱的位置都是對稱的。

sentences.english: The dog was smelling the lamp-post.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗正在聞那根路燈柱。

sentences.english: I lost control of my bike and ran into a lamp-post.
sentences.chinese: 我騎自行車失控，撞在一棵路燈柱上。

sentences.english: He ran round the corner and banged straight into a lamp-post .
sentences.chinese: 他跑過拐角處時迎面撞在燈柱上。

definition: dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
